result.execSummary:
The defendant Brian B O'Keefe was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Business Setting >$10,000, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Restitution to ADT for $20,578.52 plus surcharges to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

Court costs and DNA surcharge to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
Make/assist with making video on Ethics Training for ADT
Not to hold any fiduciary position or volunteering duties that include financial transactions.
Provide DNA sample if not already provided.

records.addlTxt:
From DOC dated 9/13/16 requesting clarification of JOC pertaining to probationary period and amendment to JOC.
Reviewed by Judge Aprahamian 9/19/16; Amend JOC to reflect dates of 5/28/2014-9/5/2014

Defendant Brian B O'Keefe in court with Attorney J Anthony Rosario.  Barbara Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Rosario makes statements.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Rosario makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:  WITHHELD SENTENCE

TERM OF PROBATION:  4 YEARS   -  transfer allowed to Milwaukee County 

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____Make/assist with making video on Ethics Training for ADT 
____Not to hold any fiduciary position or volunteering duties that include financial transactions
____DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done 
____100 Hours of Community Service  (will include hours spent developing/assisting with making of video for ADT)


RESTITUTION:  $20,578.52 to ADT (to be paid as a condition of probation - restitution to be paid before costs or fines)

COSTS:  $278.00 & $250.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid as a condition of probation)

CONDITION TIME: 6 Months, Non-working hours with standard release conditions to commence by 8:00 p.m. on 5/29/16

Felony Warnings, Voting Rights and Firearms Warnings provided to defendant

ADDRESS INFO for Brian B O'Keefe
Current: 508 11th Ave, South Milwaukee, WI 53172 United States  (Effective: 04-22-2016)
Prior: S70 W17079 Hedgewood Dr, Muskego, WI 53150
